Posts.Content: Lynne21144 wrote: I just found out that from April 1007 (Stage 3) now in July 2008 I've gone to stage 4.  I now have lung cancer and local inflmmatory breast cancer (it's now back up on my chest wall where I originally had the cancer) -- left side with chemo, surgery, chemo, radiation and then Herceptin.  I was taken off the Herc. because my heart rate kept going down.  So now I'm kind of scared because the local and the distant and the Herceptin.  Any suggestions? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: local and distant mets Lynne21144 TenderIsOurMight

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2007 05:39PM Lynne21144 wrote: Thanks for the response fom LuAnn H, BevNurse and Katie 11.  I have lymphadema in my left arm and hand so I'll try and not make too many typos. I'm at Stage IV, Her2+ (ER/PR -).  I was on Xeloda and an IV that was a trial (a # bu I can't remember what).  I was oriinally on 1500mg Xeloda 14 days + 1st day IV...I had so many side effects tht I was taken down to 1300 mg Xeloda.  My last PET/CT Scan showed that my cancer had not spread anyhere else other than the lung and locally to the chest wall (left side).  The local is usully treated by radiation but won't touch the metastasis in the lung.  The  local has eaten through my skin and I now have to wear a gauze to I don't ooze through to my shirt. They plan to start herceptin (trastumab) and HKI-272 an experimental drug.   I hope that my baseline MUGA test comes back above normal...if it works like before I won't stay on the Herceptin because the Her. affected my heart.  If this is one of the best available for Her2+ then what else is there if this fails? I've been afraid because I knew at Stage III, inflammatory, that it would come back but it is way too sooon for me. Thanks for the support .  I go to the University of Maryland in Baltimore--anyone know of others that I can seek out?  I've tried John Hopkins but never got call backs...so I figure their customer service must suck. Lynne
Posts.Title: local and distant mets Lynne21144 TenderIsOurMight
